description: Dataset containing attributes of dresses and their sales-based recommendations. Sales are monitored on alternate days. The dataset helps predict dress recommendations based on various fashion attributes.
creator: Muhammad Usman & Adeel Ahmed (Air University)

feature_description.Style: Fashion style categories: Bohemia, brief, casual, cute, fashion, flare, novelty, OL, party, sexy, vintage, work
feature_description.Price: Price range: Low, Average, Medium, High, Very-High
feature_description.Size: Size options: S, M, L, XL, Free
feature_description.Season: Seasonal category: Autumn, Winter, Spring, Summer
feature_description.NeckLine: Neckline style: O-neck, backless, board-neck, Bowneck, halter, mandarin-collar, open, peterpan-collar, ruffled, scoop, slash-neck, square-collar, sweetheart, turndowncollar, V-neck
feature_description.SleeveLength: Sleeve length: full, half, halfsleeves, butterfly, sleeveless, short, threequarter, turndown, null
feature_description.waiseline: Waist style: dropped, empire, natural, princess, null
feature_description.Material: Fabric material: wool, cotton, mix, etc.
feature_description.FabricType: Fabric type: chiffon, dobby, poplin, satin, knitted, jersey, flannel, corduroy, etc.
feature_description.Decoration: Decorative elements: applique, beading, bow, button, cascading, crystal, draped, embroidery, feathers, flowers, etc.
feature_description.Recommendation: Binary target indicating whether the dress is recommended based on sales (0 or 1)

use_case: Fashion product recommendation, sales prediction, inventory management, and understanding fashion preferences based on product attributes
data_collection: Sales data collected from fashion e-commerce platform with recommendations based on alternate day sales monitoring
challenges: Highly imbalanced dataset with subjective fashion attributes, missing values, and cultural/regional variations in fashion preferences
ethical_considerations: Fashion preferences may reflect cultural biases and socioeconomic factors. Size categories may not be inclusive of all body types

citations.author: Muhammad Usman & Adeel Ahmed
citations.title: Main steps for doing data mining project using Weka

original_source.creator: Muhammad Usman & Adeel Ahmed (Air University)
original_source.publication: Muhammad Usman & Adeel Ahmed: Main steps for doing data mining project using Weka

dataset_history: Data Collection: Sales data collected from fashion e-commerce platform with recommendations based on alternate day sales monitoring
inference_notes: Challenges: Highly imbalanced dataset with subjective fashion attributes, missing values, and cultural/regional variations in fashion preferences. Use Case: Fashion product recommendation, sales prediction, inventory management, and understanding fashion preferences based on product attributes
